title: Magnetism - relation of magnetic field to area

content.question: Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows a wire with current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> to the right passing through the center of a circle having area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>. The plane of the circle is oriented perpendicular to the wire. The magnetic field at a location on the perimeter of the circle has magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the same wire passing through the center of a circle having area <math alttext="2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi></math>. Which of the following represents the magnetic field at a location on the perimeter of the circle in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
